snippet: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey discouraged any government gift of port security equipment to the Dominican Republic, citing concern for a company run by his friend, a major campaign contributor.
abstract: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey is said to have discouraged any plan by the United States government to donate port security equipment to the Dominican Republic, citing concern that advanced screening gear might undermine efforts by a private company; company is run by Dr Salomon E Melgen, a major campaign contributor and friend; intervention with Department of Homeland Security came even though Menendez has publicly chastised the Obama administration for not doing more to combat drug traffic moving through Dominican ports.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Eric Lipton reported from Washington and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Frances Robles contributed reporting from the Dominican Republic

lead_paragraph: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey discouraged any government gift of port security equipment to the Dominican Republic, citing concern for a company run by his friend, a major campaign contributor.

headline.seo: Menendez Discouraged Giving Port Security Equipment to Dominicans
headline.main: Menendez Backed Donor on Port Security Plan
